projects.description: Designed for your motivational needs or thoughtful moments, this app generates a new random quote out of an array with altering background color everytime you click on a button or wait for a few seconds

This program takes a list of students for display on a web page while restricting the number of students which are displayed at the same time. The user can switch between the shown students via page links. There's also a search bar to dynamically filter for certain students.

An entry form for a fictional JavaScript conference. It evaluates the users input dynamically and/or if he tries to submit the form, eventually preventing him from submitting invalid data. Each relevant section displays helpful error messages to create a good UX.

A little web-based game where the player has to guess a random Metal-song by choosing single letters, eventually losing 'beer' for wrong guesses. If he runs out of beer before guessing the song, he loses the game. Fair enough.

This little app uses asynchronous JavaScript to retrieve random data from a public API and then showcasing it in a gallery of employees/users/whatever. The user can click on one of the cards to get more detailed infos about the person which is then presented via a modal which pops up.
